newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Israeli Feb-March exports, industrial imports rise.
newsitem.headline: Israeli Feb-March exports, industrial imports rise.

text.p: Israeli exports and industrial input imports showed renewed growth in February and March but industrial production remained sluggish, the Central Bureau of Statistics said on Sunday.
It reported export growth, excluding diamonds, at an annualised rate of five percent after growth of 2.0-3.0 percent between November and February.

Imports of industrial inputs grew an annualised 21 percent in March following a 19 percent annualised rise in February. Investment in machinery grew nine percent in March after four percent in February.
The bureau said retail trade grew an annualised two percent in February, after no change in January and a decline of 2.0-3.0 percent in the second half of 1996.
Industrial production was unchanged after being flat in the fourth quarter of 1996.
Imports of consumer durables rose by 13 percent in annual terms in March following a 14 percent increase in February.
The February jobless rate remained stable at seven percent.
